What was the outcome of the recent public network upgrade and testing, which aimed to harden the mainnet release?

The outcome of the recent upgrade and testing on the public network was a significant learning experience, which led to the hardening of the mainnet release. Although it may have caused a delay, the learning and consequent hardening will ensure a more secure mainnet release.

Thanks for all your testing! We’ve learned a great deal from this upgrade, and although it may feel like a delay that we took the time to learn and address it in place on the public network before moving on, this learning and consequent hardening will ensure the mainnet release will be more hardened than ever. Next steps are to upgrade auto notarization to be resilient to anything like this level of buildup over weeks automatically and prepare the mainnet release. Join us in testing everything in the #pbaas-development channel. Contribute as you learn and build, and let's all make history together! ### Additional Verus Capabilities - On-chain Launches of Token, Centralized Currency, and Liquidity Basket AMMs - On-chain Launches and Merge Mining of Independent, Connected, Interoperable Blockchains without Programming - On-chain Self Sovereign, Provable Identities, NFTs, and Individual or Organizational Profiles#### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.#### Verus Vault With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.

What are the next steps after upgrading and testing Verus?

The next steps are to upgrade auto-notarization to be resilient to similar issues in the future, and to prepare for the mainnet release. Additionally, the community is invited to participate in testing and contributing to the development of Verus in the #pbaas-development channel.

What are some of the additional capabilities of Verus?

Some of the additional capabilities of Verus include on-chain launches of tokens, centralized currencies, and liquidity basket AMMs, as well as on-chain launches and merge mining of independent, connected, and interoperable blockchains without programming. Verus also supports on-chain self-sovereign, provable identities, NFTs, and individual or organizational profiles.

What is the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and how does it work?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace is a decentralized platform where users can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs directly on the blockchain. Users can advertise their offers directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post the sale of their NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see. Transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, with the option to use transparent or zero-knowledge private addresses.

What is Verus Vault, and how does it protect funds on a VerusID?

Verus Vault is a feature that allows users to protect funds on a VerusID, even in the event of a private key being stolen. When a VerusID is locked with Vault, the funds cannot be spent until it is unlocked. While locked, the funds can still be staked on the Verus network to earn rewards. Additionally, the user can still receive funds. However, it is important to note that enabling revocation, recovery, and all Verus Vault capabilities requires a user to have at least one primary identity and one revocation/recovery ID configured.
